pull.title: fixes #1522: GUI Disappearing (Mac OSX)
pull.body:
- this solution works stable on mac and ensures that the window get's reopened when the user clicks the dock icon .
- tested on 10.8 with Qt4.8.4 and Qt5.0.1

issue.title: Cannot re-open window.
issue.body:
1. Open Bitcoin-Qt on Mac OS X ML
2. After load, close the app window
3. Click the app icon in dock

What should happen: The window should re-appear.

What is happening: Nothing.

events.message:
fix: GUI Disappearing #1522 (Mac OSX)

- this solution works stable on mac and ensures that the window get's reopened when the user clicks the dock icon .
- tested on 10.8 with Qt4.8.4 and Qt5.0.1

Signed-off-by: Jonas Schnelli <jonas.schnelli@include7.ch>

issue.title: Bitcoin-Qt 0.6.2 for Ubuntu 12.04 invisible in systray, no global menu
issue.body: After the update, the program does not appear in the system tray. Also there is no global menu.

issue.title: No way to re-open the window after closing it via the (x) button. (QT 0.8.1, Mac os 10.7x)
issue.body: Upon closing the Bitcoin-QT window using the (x) in the top left of the title bar, the Application stays open as per. usual mac app behavior, but you have no way to re-open the window belonging to the app.

issue.title: Closed window doesn't show when clicking dock icon
issue.body: I am using Bitcoin Core version v0.10.0 on OS X Yosemite 10.10.2. If I click the red close button on the window, it disappears as I would expect. But if I click the icon in the dock, the window does not show. I do not remember seeing this behavior in v0.9.

issue.title: Unhide QT window doesn't work when hidden with  + H
issue.body: Noticed this while reviewing #13529, but it's also in master @ 5ba77df. On macOS 10.13.6: * `Show` in the action menu doesn't work if the app was hidden by `Command + H`, it does work when hidden through this menu * send and receive don't unhide the window when opened for the action menu. It does navigate to the right tab. The other actions do work (sign, verify & debug window) Clicking "Toon" (= macOS native show) does work, suggesting the GUI uses some non-native method of hiding.

comments.body: possible pointer leak here: when is the MacDocIconHandler freed? Does its scope extend beyond that of the main window? If so, you should do setMainWindow(NULL) in the destructor.

It's a singleton, ... it probably never gets freed during by the app itself.
But i just added this->mainWindow = NULL; in the destructor.

I think you misunderstand me. What I mean is to set the mainwindow of your
singleton to NULL in the destructor of the _MainWindow_. This prevents a
stale pointer in your singleton after MainWindow is freed but the singleton
still lives.

Ah. Clear. Your right. Did update the code.
But i think the destructor of BitcoinGUI never gets called during the runtime.
But yes, the pointer MUST be set to NULL.

The destructor of BitcoinGUI gets called when the object goes out of scope.
Feel free to verify this and prove me wrong (this would be a bug).

The proper idiom here would be a "weak pointer". But explicitly setting it
to null to prevent a dangling pointer is ok.
